meanings.definition: One who sequesters or isolates something
meanings.sent1: The sequestrator kept the valuable documents safe.
meanings.sent2: The scientist acted as a sequestrator, separating the different chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The sequestrator squirrel hid its acorns in a secret spot.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a sequestrator, locking away memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The sequestrator of emotions, she kept her feelings hidden from others.

meanings.definition: A person or entity appointed to take possession of property in dispute
meanings.sent1: The sequestrator was responsible for safeguarding the disputed land.
meanings.sent2: The court appointed a sequestrator to handle the contested assets.
meanings.sent3: The sequestrator of the lost ring turned out to be a mischievous cat.
meanings.sent4: The sequestrator of dreams, he held onto hope in difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The sequestrator of secrets, she was entrusted with confidential information.

meanings.definition: An official who holds property in trust during legal proceedings
meanings.sent1: The sequestrator oversaw the estate during the court case.
meanings.sent2: As the sequestrator, he managed the assets until the trial was over.
meanings.sent3: The sequestrator penguin guarded the fish during the legal fish trial.
meanings.sent4: The sequestrator of time, he controlled the hourglass of fate.
meanings.sent5: The sequestrator of treasures, she protected the jewels with care.
